intro: Helicia lancifolia, commonly known as the narrow-leaved helicia, is a flowering plant native to Southeast Asia. It belongs to the family Theaceae and is characterized by its evergreen foliage and showy, fragrant flowers. The plant typically grows as a shrub or small tree, reaching heights of up to 10 meters. Its leaves are elliptical, leathery, and have a distinctive acuminate tip. The flowers are usually pale yellow or white, with five petals and numerous stamens, making it an ornamental plant in tropical gardens.
